Method Detail

hilbert2d

public static long hilbert2d(int x,
                             int y,
                             int mask)
Computes the hilbert value for two given integers. The number of bits of x and y to be considered can be determined by setting the parameter mask appropriately.

Parameters:
x - the value of the first dimension
y - the value of the second dimension
mask - the bitmask containing exactly the highest bit to be considered. If all bits of x and y should be taken into account, choose the value 1<<31.
Returns:
the hilbert value for x and y

hilbert2d

public static long hilbert2d(int x,
                             int y)
Computes the hilbert value for two given integers.

Parameters:
x - the value of the first dimension
y - the value of the second dimension
Returns:
the hilbert value for x and y

hilbert2d

public static int[] hilbert2d(long hilbert,
                              int mask)
Computes for a given hilbert value the origin values for two dimensions resulting in that hilbert value. The number of bits of the resulting values to be considered can be determined by setting the parameter mask appropriately.

Parameters:
hilbert - the given hilbert value
mask - the bitmask containing exactly the highest bit of the resulting two values to be considered. If all bits should be taken into account, choose a value of 1<<31.
Returns:
an array containing the two values whose hilbert value is equal to the specified one

hilbert2d

public static int[] hilbert2d(long hilbert)
Computes for a given hilbert value the origin values for two dimensions resulting in that hilbert value.

Parameters:
hilbert - the given hilbert value
Returns:
an array containing the two values whose hilbert value is equal to the specified one

                           int y,
                           int mask)
Computes the peano value for two given integers. The number of bits of x and y to be considered can be determined by setting the parameter mask appropriately.

Parameters:
x - the value of the first dimension
y - the value of the second dimension
mask - the bitmask containing exactly the highest bit to be considered. If all bits of x and y should be taken into account, choose the value 1<<31.
Returns:
the peano value for x and y

peano2d

public static long peano2d(int x,
                           int y)
Computes the peano value for two given integers.

Parameters:
x - the value of the first dimension
y - the value of the second dimension
Returns:
the peano value for x and y considering every bit

peano2d

public static int[] peano2d(long peano,
                            int mask)
Computes for a given peano value the values for two dimensions resulting in that peano value. The number of bits of the resulting values to be considered can be determined by setting the parameter mask appropriately.

Parameters:
peano - the given peano value
mask - the bitmask containing exactly the highest bit to be considered for the resulting two values. If all bits should be taken into account, choose the value 1<<31.
Returns:
an array containing the two values whose peano value is equal to the specified one

Computes for a given peano value the origin values for two dimensions resulting in that peano value.

Parameters:
peano - the given peano value
Returns:
an array containing the two values whose peano value is equal to the specified one

zCode

public static BitSet zCode(long[] bitField,
                           int componentPrecision)
Computes the z-code of the given bit field, bitField, by merging the the bit-field-longs and returns it as a BitSet.
The BitSet's precision is set to:
        componentPrecision*bitField.length
So the basic used precision is the array's component precision.

Parameters:
bitField - a long array the z-code should be computed of.
componentPrecision - the bitField's component precision.
Returns:
a BitSet representing the z-code of the given bitField.
See Also:
BitSet.BitSet(int), zCode(long[], int, int)

zCode2

public static BitSet zCode2(long[] bitField,
                            int precision)
Computes the z-code of the given bit field, bitField, by merging the bit-field-longs and returns it as a BitSet.
(EXPERIMENTAL)

Parameters:
bitField - a long array the z-code should be computed of.
precision - the returned BitSet's full precision.
Returns:
a BitSet representing the z-code of the given bitField.
See Also:
BitSet.BitSet(int), zCode(long[], int, int)

zCode

public static BitSet zCode(long[] bitField,
                           int componentPrecision,
                           int additionalBits)
Computes the z-code of the given bit field, bitField, by merging the bit-field-longs and returns it as a BitSet.
The BitSet's precision is set to:
        componentPrecision*bitField.length+additionalBits
So the basic used precision is the array's component precision, but it can be increased by adding additionalBits.

Parameters:
bitField - a long array the z-code should be computed of.
componentPrecision - the bitField's component precision.
additionalBits - added bits, that should be taken into consideration too, i.e. the precision of the BitSet is incremented by this value.
Returns:
a BitSet representing the z-code of the given bitField.
See Also:
BitSet.BitSet(int)

zCode

public static BitSet zCode(Rectangle rectangle,
                           int maxLevel)
Alternative computation of z-codes. Computes the z-code for a given rectangle using a quadtree based splitting strategy.
Precondition: MBR of the data subseteq [0;1)^dim.

Parameters:
rectangle - the rectangle for which the z-code should be computed
maxLevel - the highest partitioning level allowed
Returns:
a BitSet representing the z-code of the given rectangle.
See Also:
BitSet.BitSet(int)
